verses.kjv: These are the words of the covenant, which the LORD commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, beside the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
verses.web: These are the words of the covenant which LORD commanded Moses to make with the children of Israel in the land of Moab, in addition to the covenant which he made with them in Horeb.
verses.ct: These are the terms of the covenant that the LORD commanded Moses to establish with the people of Israel in the land of Moab — a covenant in addition to the one he had already made with them at Horeb.

verses.kjv: And Moses called unto all Israel, and said unto them, Ye have seen all that the LORD did before your eyes in the land of Egypt unto Pharaoh, and unto all his servants, and unto all his land;
verses.web: Moses called to all Israel, and said to them: Your eyes have seen all that LORD did in the land of Egypt to Pharaoh, and to all his servants, and to all his land;
verses.ct: Moses gathered all of Israel together and said to them, "You saw with your own eyes everything the LORD did in Egypt to Pharaoh, to all his officials, and to his entire land.

verses.kjv: The great temptations which thine eyes have seen, the signs, and those great miracles:
verses.web: the great trials which your eyes saw, the signs, and those great wonders.
verses.ct: You witnessed the devastating trials, the miraculous signs, and the incredible wonders.

verses.kjv: Yet the LORD hath not given you an heart to perceive, and eyes to see, and ears to hear, unto this day.
verses.web: But LORD has not given you a heart to know, eyes to see, and ears to hear, to this day.
verses.ct: But to this day, the LORD has not given you a heart that truly understands, eyes that truly see, or ears that truly hear.

verses.kjv: And I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes are not waxen old upon you, and thy shoe is not waxen old upon thy foot.
verses.web: I have led you forty years in the wilderness. Your clothes have not grown old on you, and your sandals have not grown old on your feet.
verses.ct: For 40 years I led you through the wilderness. During that time, your clothes never wore out, and your sandals never fell apart on your feet.

verses.kjv: Ye have not eaten bread, neither have ye drunk wine or strong drink: that ye might know that I am the LORD your God.
verses.web: You have not eaten bread, neither have you drunk wine or strong drink, that you may know that I am LORD your God.
verses.ct: You didn't eat bread or drink wine or any other strong drink — so that you would know that I am the LORD your God.

verses.kjv: And when ye came unto this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon, and Og the king of Bashan, came out against us unto battle, and we smote them:
verses.web: When you came to this place, Sihon the king of Heshbon and Og the king of Bashan came out against us to battle, and we struck them.
verses.ct: When you arrived at this place, King Sihon of Heshbon and King Og of Bashan marched out to fight us, and we defeated them.

verses.kjv: And we took their land, and gave it for an inheritance unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half tribe of Manasseh.
verses.web: We took their land, and gave it for an inheritance to the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to the half-tribe of the Manassites.
verses.ct: We took their land and gave it as an inheritance to the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and the half-tribe of Manasseh.

verses.kjv: Keep therefore the words of this covenant, and do them, that ye may prosper in all that ye do.
verses.web: Therefore keep the words of this covenant and do them, that you may prosper in all that you do.
verses.ct: So obey the terms of this covenant and follow them carefully, so that you will succeed in everything you do.

verses.kjv: Ye stand this day all of you before the LORD your God; your captains of your tribes, your elders, and your officers, with all the men of Israel,
verses.web: All of you stand today in the presence of LORD your God: your heads, your tribes, your elders, and your officers, even all the men of Israel,
verses.ct: Today, all of you are standing before the LORD your God — your leaders, your tribal heads, your elders, your officials, and every man in Israel,

verses.kjv: Your little ones, your wives, and thy stranger that is in thy camp, from the hewer of thy wood unto the drawer of thy water:
verses.web: your little ones, your wives, and the foreigners who are in the middle of your camps, from the one who cuts your wood to the one who draws your water,
verses.ct: along with your children, your wives, and the foreigners living in your camps, from those who chop your wood to those who carry your water.

verses.kjv: That thou shouldest enter into covenant with the LORD thy God, and into his oath, which the LORD thy God maketh with thee this day:
verses.web: that you may enter into the covenant of LORD your God, and into his oath, which LORD your God makes with you today,
verses.ct: You are here to enter into the covenant of the LORD your God, sealed with an oath, which the LORD your God is making with you today.

verses.kjv: That he may establish thee to day for a people unto himself, and that he may be unto thee a God, as he hath said unto thee, and as he hath sworn unto thy fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.web: that he may establish you today as his people, and that he may be your God, as he spoke to you and as he swore to your fathers, to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob.
verses.ct: He is doing this to establish you as his own people, and to be your God — just as he promised you and swore to your ancestors Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob.

verses.kjv: Neither with you only do I make this covenant and this oath;
verses.web: Neither do I make this covenant and this oath with you only,
verses.ct: This covenant and this oath are not just for you alone.

verses.kjv: But with him that standeth here with us this day before the LORD our God, and also with him that is not here with us this day:
verses.web: but with those who stand here with us today before LORD our God, and also with those who are not here with us today
verses.ct: They are for everyone standing here with us today before the LORD our God, and also for those who are not here with us today.

verses.kjv: (For ye know how we have dwelt in the land of Egypt; and how we came through the nations which ye passed by;
verses.web: (for you know how we lived in the land of Egypt, and how we came through the middle of the nations through which you passed;
verses.ct: (You remember what it was like living in Egypt, and you remember passing through the territories of other nations along the way.

verses.kjv: And ye have seen their abominations, and their idols, wood and stone, silver and gold, which were among them:)
verses.web: and you have seen their abominations and their idols of wood, stone, silver, and gold, which were among them);
verses.ct: You saw their disgusting practices and their idols made of wood, stone, silver, and gold.)

verses.kjv: Lest there should be among you man, or woman, or family, or tribe, whose heart turneth away this day from the LORD our God, to go and serve the gods of these nations; lest there should be among you a root that beareth gall and wormwood;
verses.web: lest there should be among you man, woman, family, or tribe whose heart turns away today from LORD our God, to go to serve the gods of those nations; lest there should be among you a root that produces bitter poison;
verses.ct: Make sure there is no man, woman, family, or tribe among you whose heart turns away from the LORD our God today to go and worship the gods of those nations. Don't let there be a root among you that produces bitter poison.

verses.kjv: And it come to pass, when he heareth the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, I shall have peace, though I walk in the imagination of mine heart, to add drunkenness to thirst:
verses.web: and it happen, when he hears the words of this curse, that he bless himself in his heart, saying, “I shall have peace, though I walk in the stubbornness of my heart,” to destroy the moist with the dry.
verses.ct: If someone hears the words of this curse and reassures himself, thinking, 'I'll be fine even though I follow my own stubborn desires' — bringing ruin on everyone, the well-watered along with the dry —

verses.kjv: The LORD will not spare him, but then the anger of the LORD and his jealousy shall smoke against that man, and all the curses that are written in this book shall lie upon him, and the LORD shall blot out his name from under heaven.
verses.web: LORD will not pardon him, but then LORD’s anger and his jealousy will smoke against that man, and all the curse that is written in this book will fall on him, and LORD will blot out his name from under the sky.
verses.ct: the LORD will not forgive that person. Instead, the LORD's anger and jealousy will burn hot against him. Every curse written in this book will fall on him, and the LORD will blot out his name from under heaven.

verses.kjv: And the LORD shall separate him unto evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant that are written in this book of the law:
verses.web: LORD will set him apart for evil out of all the tribes of Israel, according to all the curses of the covenant written in this book of the law.
verses.ct: The LORD will single him out from all the tribes of Israel for disaster, in keeping with every curse of the covenant written in this book of the law.

verses.kjv: So that the generation to come of your children that shall rise up after you, and the stranger that shall come from a far land, shall say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses which the LORD hath laid upon it;
verses.web: The generation to come—your children who will rise up after you, and the foreigner who will come from a far land—will say, when they see the plagues of that land, and the sicknesses with which LORD has made it sick,
verses.ct: Future generations — your own descendants and foreigners who come from distant lands — will see the devastation of the land and the diseases the LORD has brought upon it, and they will ask,

verses.kjv: And that the whole land thereof is brimstone, and salt, and burning, that it is not sown, nor beareth, nor any grass groweth therein, like the overthrow of Sodom, and Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboim, which the LORD overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath:
verses.web: that all of its land is sulfur, salt, and burning, that it is not sown, doesn’t produce, nor does any grass grow in it, like the overthrow of Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, which LORD overthrew in his anger, and in his wrath.
verses.ct: 'Why is this entire land nothing but sulfur, salt, and scorched earth? Nothing is planted, nothing grows — not even a blade of grass. It looks like Sodom and Gomorrah, Admah and Zeboiim, which the LORD destroyed in his fierce anger.'

verses.kjv: Even all nations shall say, Wherefore hath the LORD done thus unto this land? what meaneth the heat of this great anger?
verses.web: Even all the nations will say, “Why has LORD done this to this land? What does the heat of this great anger mean?”
verses.ct: Every nation will ask, 'Why did the LORD do this to this land? What caused such burning anger?'

verses.kjv: Then men shall say, Because they have forsaken the covenant of the LORD God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them forth out of the land of Egypt:
verses.web: Then men will say, “Because they abandoned the covenant of LORD, the God of their fathers, which he made with them when he brought them out of the land of Egypt,
verses.ct: And the answer will be: 'Because they abandoned the covenant of the LORD, the God of their ancestors — the covenant he made with them when he brought them out of Egypt.

verses.kjv: For they went and served other gods, and worshipped them, gods whom they knew not, and whom he had not given unto them:
verses.web: and went and served other gods and worshiped them, gods that they didn’t know and that he had not given to them.
verses.ct: They went off and served other gods, bowing down to gods they had never known — gods the LORD had never assigned to them.

verses.kjv: And the anger of the LORD was kindled against this land, to bring upon it all the curses that are written in this book:
verses.web: Therefore LORD’s anger burned against this land, to bring on it all the curses that are written in this book.
verses.ct: So the LORD's anger burned against this land, and he brought down on it every curse written in this book.

verses.kjv: And the LORD rooted them out of their land in anger, and in wrath, and in great indignation, and cast them into another land, as it is this day.
verses.web: LORD rooted them out of their land in anger, in wrath, and in great indignation, and thrust them into another land, as it is today.”
verses.ct: In his anger, wrath, and fierce fury, the LORD uprooted them from their land and threw them into another land, where they remain to this day."

verses.kjv: The secret things belong unto the LORD our God: but those things which are revealed belong unto us and to our children for ever, that we may do all the words of this law.
verses.web: The secret things belong to LORD our God; but the things that are revealed belong to us and to our children forever, that we may do all the words of this law.
verses.ct: The secret things belong to the LORD our God, but the things he has revealed belong to us and to our children forever, so that we may obey every word of this law.
